text:
What's the dev workflow for scraping git repos in your package? Declare them as artifacts?
AKA I want to parse some files in 2 different Github repos and generate tests based on those, but they will be updated, so I want the code to handle pull in those updates and work accordingly.

elements.text:
What's the dev workflow for scraping git repos in your package? Declare them as artifacts?
AKA I want to parse some files in 2 different Github repos and generate tests based on those, but they will be updated, so I want the code to handle pull in those updates and work accordingly.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
It might be overkill but I think a BinaryBuilder is the easiest ... ?

elements.text: It might be overkill but I think a BinaryBuilder is the easiest ... ?

text: <@UDB26738Q> is it a crime to use BB for this? I just want to autodownload 2 github repos with an empty BB build script.

elements.text: is it a crime to use BB for this? I just want to autodownload 2 github repos with an empty BB build script.

text: (BB errors at step4 of selecting build products and I can't deploy it)

elements.text: (BB errors at step4 of selecting build products and I can't deploy it)

text: OK I think I need to actually be thinking about using a build.jl script

elements.text: OK I think I need to actually be thinking about using a build.jl script

text: This was a great recommend <@UDB26738Q>. Is there a reason it can't handle zip files?

elements.text: . Is there a reason it can't handle zip files?

text: Pkg hardcodes supported files, they are all tarballs

elements.text: Pkg hardcodes supported files, they are all tarballs

text: Gotcha. So what's the best approach for artifacts'ing a github repo that doesn't have a tagged realease with a tarball?

elements.text: Gotcha. So what's the best approach for artifacts'ing a github repo that doesn't have a tagged realease with a tarball?

text: so you want to download a tarball of a snapshot of a revision?

text: Oh nevermind, they just released one. All is good.
